intro: Streptocarpus roseoalbus, commonly known as the white-flowered streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Streptocarpus roseoalbus thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
